metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2938 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.27 and prior and 8.0.17 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.4 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-common - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
